A wise son <FI>heareth<Fi> his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.<CM>
A man shall eat good by the fruit of <FI>his<Fi> mouth: but the soul of the transgressors <FI>shall eat<Fi> violence.<CM>
He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: <FI>but<Fi> he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.<CM>
The soul of the sluggard desireth, and <FI>hath<Fi> nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.<CM>
A righteous <FI>man<Fi> hateth lying: but a wicked <FI>man<Fi> is loathsome, and cometh to shame.<CM>
Righteousness keepeth <FI>him that is<Fi> upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.<RF>the sinner: Heb. sin<Rf><CM>
There is that maketh himself rich, yet <FI>hath<Fi> nothing: <FI>there is<Fi> that maketh himself poor, yet <FI>hath<Fi> great riches.<CM>
The ransom of a man's life <FI>are<Fi> his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.<CM>
The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.<RF>lamp: or, candle<Rf><CM>
Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised <FI>is<Fi> wisdom.<CM>
Wealth <FI>gotten<Fi> by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.<RF>by labour: Heb. with the hand<Rf><CM>
Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but <FI>when<Fi> the desire cometh, <FI>it is<Fi> a tree of life.<CM>
Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.<RF>shall be rewarded: or, shall be in peace<Rf><CM>
The law of the wise <FI>is<Fi> a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.<CM>
Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors <FI>is<Fi> hard.<CM>
Every prudent <FI>man<Fi> dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open <FI>his<Fi> folly.<RF>layeth…: Heb. spreadeth<Rf><CM>
A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador <FI>is<Fi> health.<RF>a faithful…: Heb. an ambassador of faithfulness<Rf><CM>
Poverty and shame <FI>shall be to<Fi> him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.<CM>
The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but <FI>it is<Fi> abomination to fools to depart from evil.<CM>
He that walketh with wise <FI>men<Fi> shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.<RF>destroyed: Heb. broken<Rf><CM>
Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.<CM>
A good <FI>man<Fi> leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner <FI>is<Fi> laid up for the just.<CM>
Much food <FI>is in<Fi> the tillage of the poor: but there is <FI>that is<Fi> destroyed for want of judgment.<CM>
He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.<CM>
The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.<CM>
